Sentencas: Ultrasonic mist pyrolysis was applied to electrode preparation for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) type reactor.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: La1.8Al0.2O3 anode catalyst was prepared on heated YSZ substrate by the pyrolysis of the mist of lanthanum nitrate and aluminum nitrate mixed aqueous solution generated by ultrasonic transducer.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: Among several preparation methods, this process was most effective for the activity of anode catalyst.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: Operating conditions such as aqueous solution concentration, temperature and ultrasonic power mere examined.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: The effects of these conditions on the particle characteristic such as supported amount and size were investigated.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: Changes of catalyst in the crystallographic characteristics were also evaluated by XRD.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: The particle size of the anode catalyst on YSZ substrate was found to be important for the oxidative coupling of methane in SOFC reactor.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: Smaller particle size was preferred for this reaction.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution

Sentencas: The particle size could be easily controlled by the operating conditions of ultrasonic mist pyrolysis and then optimum preparation condition was confirmed.
Titulo: Preparation of electrode catalyst for SOFC reactor by ultrasonic mist pyrolysis of aqueous solution
